meta.title: About NIPKaart
meta.description: NIPKaart makes data on accessible parking and garage occupancy easy to understand, so you know where to go before you leave.

hero.title: Makes data insightful for you
hero.subtitle: We've compiled information about disabled parking, local regulations, and (semi-)live garage occupancy. This way, you can be sure you're well-prepared for your trip.

intro.heading: Why NIPKaart?
body: Whether you hold a disabled parking card (GPK) or support someone who does, NIPKaart shows you in advance where you can park, what conditions apply, and which alternatives are available.

NIPKaart originated from a geoweb project during studies, it has since grown into a platform with data for the Netherlands and an increasing number of European locations. In 2025 the platform was rebuilt from the ground up for better performance, accessibility, and maintainability.

what.heading: What you can do
what.text: For each location we show, among other things:
list: The orientation of the parking space
Time limits and conditions (e.g., blue zone or time windows).
A link to local parking rules where available.
A Navigate button to instantly start a route in your maps app.
Garage or P+R as fallback, with (semi-)live occupancy.

share.title: Share a map view
share.desc: Share exactly what you see: Copy the URL from your address bar and others will instantly open the same area with parking spaces around their destination.

offstreet.title: Garage & P+R occupancy
offstreet.desc: Check (semi-)live occupancy to avoid encountering a closed barrier. Note: Parking in a garage is often paid.

search.title: Fast search
search.desc: Find by place, street, or garage name and jump straight there on the map.

disclaimer: All information on the website is indicative. Parking is at your own risk; no rights can be derived.
